column5: Heading up to LOTW near Sioux Narrows on Wednesday. Any recent fishing reports, depth, and what was happening would be appreciated.
Hey, same here, leaving this week, any info, would be nice

try http://justfishontario.com/reports.htm they have a bunch of reports on the LOTW. I understand the fishing has been great all over northwestern Ontario. Walleyes are in their summer patterns relating to the deeper water, underwater humps, shorelines of islands, and deep edges of weed beds. By the way that site has a page that is called Secret Spots that give you some GPS spots for summer walleyes. I guess the guy used to fish the Woods about a 150 days a year and has a pretty good handle on it. Good luck.

The fishing on the Woods is great. Walleyes, smallies, northerns, perch are all doing well. Muskies seem to be getting ready for the big ones to really go. Haven't heard of many giants yet. Heard of the big girls following alot but not really munching.
Heading up next Thurs. morning. Any current info would help! Thanks and hows the water level??

Fished out of Sioux Narrows a week ago. Best luck with spinners and crawlers, best depth 24 ft. Around most reefs past Yellow Girl Point. also Dead Broke channel. Caught fish most eveery time we stopped but quite a ways out. Largest 27" released. Some Lake trout caught south into Whitefish bay at 100 ft. Flutter spoons and lots of weight.Good Luck :)

Check out http://www.justfishontario.com and look up there Secret Spots page, some good stuff. I used their way points and they were right on. Plus found spots on our too. Parking near Shore Island is great, in the middle of fab fishing.

Any one have any luck staying closer to the Narrows and fishing Bass or Pike? Also, how far of a run were you guys making to get into the good walleye grounds past YG point? Going up there for my first time in 2 weeks, so any information is appreciated. If you rather not say here, please e-mail me at [email protected] Mucho appreciato
